course.title: Social Problems of the American Economy
course.description: Examines selected social and economic problems of the US and evaluates market and governmental solutions. Topics include discrimination, income and wage inequality, welfare reform, antipoverty strategy (including education and training programs), homelessness, crime, and charitable behavior.
course.prerequisites: Ec 10a and Ec 10b or permission of the instructor.
course.notes: A research paper is required. This course meets the concentration writing requirement.
